channel.title: Stop people from editing
channel.description:
Not sure if this is in the right place and i have searhced
How do I stop people from editing my client? ive tried making all files read only and hidden but then I cant start up the client it says access is denied :( is there any other way?

item.title: Stop people from editing
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Hash it, then build the correct hash into the client somewhere important (make it necessary to run).

White Castle:

You can always wrap the .jar into an .exe, I’m sure that’d be hard as fuck to figure out. Go here to download JShrink, which wraps .jars.

Those are usually executable archives or programs with the original JAR stored as a resource.
gcj is the best free solution that I know of, but it makes a “Hello, World” program build to >6mb

Read full topic

item.title: Stop people from editing
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

Do you mean like put it in a jar file? A jar file can be easily extracted so that’s not going to make it any more difficult to edit. But if that is truly what you want to do, then you’ll need to do this:

  1. compile your client ( javac -cp . *.java )
  2. create your jar file ( jar cvf jarfilename.jar *.class )
  3. run it ( java -cp .;./jarfilename.jar; client )

I don’t know if that’s what you want or not. If you put line 3 in the batch file, you could distribute just the jar and batch file. Unless, of course, the client needs other non-rs files (data files, configs, etc)

No clue if that’s what you wanted or not, because most people could still easily edit “your” client, but there it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop people from editing
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

Jagex has tried and tried to “stop people from editing my client” and it hasnt worked yet. My point is that since it isnt really your client to begin with, you shouldnt be bothering with trying to prevent people from making any changes. But they do their “prevention” through obfuscation. Maybe look into that if you care enough about it, but java is not a very “source-safe” programming language.

off-topic
Gotta love pressing the single quote or forward slash and watching it bring up the find menu. =forwardslashhere

Read full topic
